  "question_id": "ed04_q07_temporal",

  "question_type": "temporal",
  "prompt": "When did chromium levels at the mid-river station first exceed background levels, and has the concentration been stable or changing?",
  "ground_truth": {
    "canonical_answer": "Chromium levels at WQ-03 first exceeded background during the early signal phase. The concentration has been progressively increasing, from 12-18 ug/L initially to 40-65 ug/L during escalation, indicating an ongoing or worsening discharge.",
    "required_evidence_refs": [
      "environmental_drift_04_ep_011",
      "environmental_drift_04_ep_013",
      "environmental_drift_04_ep_017",
      "environmental_drift_04_ep_025"
    ],
    "key_facts": [
      "progressive chromium concentration decay from peak station to downstream sites indicates single-source contamination",
      "stations upstream of the anomaly source maintain background-level trace metal readings throughout the study",
      "chromium concentrations at the peak monitoring station increased progressively across successive sampling periods, inconsistent with episodic contamination events"
    ]
  }
}
